TopicTitle: If Craft or Kerbal is Off the Ground Generating Zero Thrust they are Being Quickly Moved Horizontally (Dres and Eeloo so far)

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.1.4.1 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: 19045.3448 | CPU: 10900X | GPU: 2070 | RAM: 128

 

Any input of force while on EVA or in craft of Dres, upon finishing the input manifests a phantom force that doesn't seem to be related to the input of the force.  When the player applies force the phantom force is removed.

As in the video, jumping reproduces it, upon finishing any RCS input reproduces, walking doesn't seem to be affected. Craft also manifests the same behaviour. Fully stock game.

 

Included Attachments:

KerbalSpaceProgram22023-10-0719-49-36.mp4

Edited October 15, 2023 by Anth12

I've experienced the same thing.

When walking uphill on the surface i have been pushed away from the hill. But always in north south direction. So when walking east west I also have been pushed to the south.
Maybe it has to do something with the inclanation of the planet around kerbol?

Reported Version: v0.1.4.1 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Windows 10 | CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-6700 CPU @ 3.40GHz | GPU: AMD Radeon R7 200 Series | RAM: 32 GB

 

As the Title says I was going to land, but my ship was suddenly moved a few meters away everytime I had cut the power to the engines, which made me crash on to the surface.

ShadowZone had the similar problem in his last video, if you want to see it here  :
